revised_title: Influence of Liquid Composition on Soot Formation in Methanol/Toluene Mixture Droplet Combustion in Microgravity
tldr: An experimental study was conducted to examine the influence of liquid composition on soot formation and burning rate of methanol/toluene mixture droplets in a microgravity environment. The study found that toluene concentration in methanol significantly affected flame luminosity and soot production. Burning rates and flame extinction were not significantly affected by toluene mixture fractions. The results provide insights into controlling flame luminosity and particulate formation by mixing alcohol and aromatic fuels, which can have implications for vehicle fuel and hazardous waste liquid management.
